perturbation.original_text:
3.1	Initial Term

The initial term of this Agreement shall commence upon the Effective Date and shall expire ten (10) years from the Effective Date, unless sooner terminated under the terms of this Agreement. You shall have no right or option to extend or renew the term of this Agreement except as provided in Section 3.2 of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
3.1	Initial Term

The initial term of this Agreement shall commence upon the Effective Date and shall expire ten (10) years from the Effective Date, unless sooner terminated under the terms of this Agreement. You shall have the right or option to extend or renew the term of this Agreement automatically for one (1) additional ten (10) year terms.
perturbation.explanation: This change directly contradicts the original text, which stated that the franchisee had *no* automatic right to renew the agreement, and instead needed to fulfill a list of explicit requirements. The modified text introduces an automatic renewal.

perturbation.original_text:
5.15	Policies and Procedures

You shall not have the right to establish policies and/or procedures pertaining to the operation of the Franchised Business to protect the Proprietary Marks and our goodwill in the industry outside of the policies and/or procedures that we designate. You and all Unit Franchisees subject to the license granted under this Agreement shall be bound by our policies and/or procedures upon receipt of the same.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.15	Policies and Procedures

You have the right to establish policies and/or procedures pertaining to the operation of the Franchised Business, as long as such policies are in line with established guidelines, to protect the Proprietary Marks and our goodwill in the industry. You and all Unit Franchisees subject to the license granted under this Agreement may or may not follow our policies and/or procedures upon receipt of the same, at your discretion.
perturbation.explanation: The original text gives the franchisor complete control over policies and procedures. The modified text now gives the franchisee some control over policies, undermining the franchise agreement's System. Additionally, it becomes optional to adhere to the policies, making enforcement of the system almost impossible.

perturbation.original_text: 4.2.3	In addition to the Unit Franchise Performance Royalty Fee and Franchise Sales Royalty Fee described above, you shall collect from each Unit Franchisee in your Master Territory a “National Advertising Fund Contribution” to be contributed to our “National Advertising Fund” pursuant to the terms of the individual Unit Franchise Agreements. For each Unit Franchise you own and operate, you shall pay the National Advertising Fund Contribution on the same basis as Unit Franchisees. The National Advertising Fund Contribution shall be collected by you from each Unit Franchisee and spent by you in accordance with the agreement on behalf of the franchisor and Franchisees.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.2.3	In addition to the Unit Franchise Performance Royalty Fee and Franchise Sales Royalty Fee described above, you shall collect from each Unit Franchisee in your Master Territory a “National Advertising Fund Contribution” to be contributed to our “National Advertising Fund” pursuant to the terms of the individual Unit Franchise Agreements. For each Unit Franchise you own and operate, you shall pay the National Advertising Fund Contribution on the same basis as Unit Franchisees. The National Advertising Fund Contribution may be collected by you from each Unit Franchisee at your discretion and will be spent by the franchisor.
perturbation.explanation: This introduces contradiction as the franchisee can choose whether to collect, while also making it sound like the franchisor is in charge of spending. This muddies who is responsible and the financial obligations.
